data.quote: There are some things you learn best in calm, and some in storm.
data.author: Willa Cather

data.quote: It does not do to dwell on dreams and forget to live.
data.author: J.K. Rowling

data.quote: Life is to be lived, not controlled; and humanity is won by continuing to play in face of certain defeat.
data.author: Ralph Ellison

data.quote: I am not afraid of storms, for I am learning how to sail my ship.
data.author: Louisa May Alcott

data.quote: And so we beat on, boats against the current, borne back ceaselessly into the past.
data.author: F. Scott Fitzgerald

data.quote: I took a deep breath and listened to the old brag of my heart: I am, I am, I am.
data.author: Sylvia Plath

data.quote: This above all: To thine own self be true, And it must follow, as the night the day, Thou canst not then be false to any man.
data.author: William Shakespeare

data.quote: The only way out of the labyrinth of suffering is to forgive.
data.author: John Green

data.quote: Beware; for I am fearless, and therefore powerful.
data.author: Mary Shelley

data.quote: I am no bird; and no net ensnares me: I am a free human being with an independent will, which I now exert to leave you.
data.author: Charlotte Brontë

data.quote: It is only with the heart that one can see rightly; what is essential is invisible to the eye.
data.author: Antoine de Saint-Exupéry

data.quote: Not all those who wander are lost.
data.author: J.R.R. Tolkien
